summary:
Experienced project manager, research planner, agricultural researcher, and geographer with three decades of experience working with and in developing countries to improve the livelihood of smallholder farmers.

I enjoy working with innovative approaches to rural development, creating synergy between researchers, farmers and NGOs in the fields of bio-fuels, agro-forestry, and agriculture.

Mastering and understanding multiple disciplines and finding solutions that will lead to results under difficult circumstances in the field are my forte. I am good at connecting the dots.
 
I have worked with these themes while employed by universities, donors, NGOs, international research institutions and as a consultant. Africa is my stomping ground, having lived there for more than 15 years.
 
With a PhD in Agricultural Geography I have a solid background in agricultural research but have over the years developed skills in research and project management, GIS (in particular with Open Source Software) and Internet technologies.

profile_positions.description: Project leader for the applied research project CommonGround. The project target 100,000 smallholder farmers in land restoration and inclusive development of farming systems in two regions in Uganda.

profile_positions.description:
Managing the 11,000,000 EUR "Wadi El Ku Integrated Catchment Management project II"
(WEK II) in North Darfur implemented by UNEP with support from the EU. The project will increase
agricultural yields and value chain productivity while safeguarding ecosystem integrity and improve
social cohesion. Direct beneficiaries are ~100.000. Based in El Fasher, Darfur.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Research and project management: Coordination of several research projects targeting improved production, resilience, gender balance, nutrition and income of small holder farmers.

B​ased in Eastern DR Congo at the IITA owned Kalambo Research Station managing research in DR Congo⚑, Burundi⚑, Rwanda⚑, Nigeria⚑ and Kenya⚑. Responsible for technical and financial decisions with reporting to IFAD, EC and CGIAR.

Research focused on NRM (especially erosion dynamics), crop-livestock integration and drones as research tools. Main crops: cassava and banana with some activities covering maize, soybean, common bean, yam, Calliandra and other fodder species.

Successful fund raising and proposal development targeting multiple donors, including the World Bank (WB), African Development Bank (AfDB), IDRC, USAid, and Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation (BMGF).
profile_positions.title: Farming System Agronomist/System Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Contracted by FACT Foundation for R&D on agronomic and socio-economic issues related to biofuel and development as well as ICT.  

Managed the research component of the four-year FACT/ADPP Jatropha Project in Mozambique [http://mozambiquejatropha.bananahill.net].  It is one of the few successful Jatropha projects for smallholders. Farmers in the area continue to increase Jatropha cultivation years the project ended. A significant number of research papers and MSc's resulted from this work.

Assignments in Guinea Bissau⚑, Mozambique⚑ and the Netherlands⚑.

profile_positions.description:
Seconded to IIAM (Instituto de Investigação Agrária de Moçambique⚑) by Danida (Min. of Foreign Affairs, Denmark). Assisted in implementing reform of the agricultural research system.

Activities included backstopping and management support to Zonal Research Centre Coordinator, participation in various committees for planning and coordination of research at the national level, guiding researchers and establishing local and international collaboration with CGIAR centres and universities.

Major achievements include input to national and regional research planning, establishing a successful MSc training program with international partners, preparing tender for ICT equipment for research station, training of researchers in statistics, training in ICT and web technologies, contributing to the institutions website, quality control, and fund-raising; organising study tours for high level staff to Zambia⚑ and Uganda⚑; designing and implementing a variety preference survey and trials on agroforestry and biofuels; collecting seeds of Jatropha curcas for studies of genetic variation and of Baobab (Adansonia digitata) for international gene bank.
